item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Red Army Faction
item.description: "We’re not feeling edgy; the system is feeling nervous." -- Red Army Faction

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Red Army Faction
item.description:
"The fact is that the system in the metropole reproduces itself through an ongoing offensive against the people’s psyche, not in an openly fascist way, but rather through the market.
Therefore, to write off entire sections of the population as an impediment to anti-imperialist struggle, simply because they don’t fit into Marx’ analysis of capitalism, is as insane and sectarian as it is un-Marxist." -- Red Army Faction

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Red Army Faction
item.description: "The rejection of sabotage in the metropole, based on the argument that it would be better to take things over instead of destroying them, is based on the dictum: The people of the Third World should wait for their revolution until the masses in the metropole catch up." -- Red Army Faction

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Red ARMY FACTION
item.description: "They see in the political apathy of the proletariat only the apathy, not the protest against a system that has nothing to offer them." -- Red ARMY FACTION

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Red ARMY FACTION
item.description: "They see in the population’s hostility towards the left only the hostility towards the left, not the hatred against those who are socially privileged." -- Red ARMY FACTION

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Red Army Faction
item.description: "Following this logic, to bomb BASF in Ludwigshafen would be to mock the people who bombed BASF in Brazil. The Latin American comrades feel differently. BASF does as well." -- Red Army Faction

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Red Army Faction
item.description: "In its offensive against the state, the urban guerilla cannot resort to terrorism as a weapon." -- Red Army Faction

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Bruce Cockburn
item.description: "The trouble with normal is it always gets worse." -- Bruce Cockburn

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "There is a war between the ones who say there is a war and the ones who say there isn't." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Fish cannot carry guns." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Carl Von Clausewitz
item.description: "Pity the theory which sets itself in opposition to the mind! It cannot repair this contradiction by any humility, and the humbler it is so much the sooner will ridicule and contempt drive it from real life." -- Carl Von Clausewitz

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Carl Von Clausewitz
item.description: "There are cases in which the greatest daring is the greatest wisdom." -- Carl Von Clausewitz

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by bell hooks
item.description: "I grew up in the midst of poverty but every black kid that I knew could read and write. We have to talk about the fact that we cannot educate for critical consciousness if we have a group of people who cannot access Fanon, Cabral, or Audre Lorde because they can’t read or write. How did Malcolm X radicalize his consciousness? He did it through books. If you deprive working-class and poor black people of access to reading and writing, you are making them that much farther removed from being a class that can engage in revolutionary resistance." -- bell hooks

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Ward Churchill
item.description: "Could it be that toxic mimics are toxic because they ignore responsibility, they ignore relationship, they ignore presence, they substitute control for fluidity and choice?" -- Ward Churchill

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by R.G. Collingwood
item.description: "Thus natural science is not a way of knowing the real world; its value lies not in its truth but in its utility; by scientific thought we do not know nature, we dismember it in order to master it." -- R.G. Collingwood

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Jay Lake
item.description: "Writing is self-reinforcing. Don't make a fetish out of it, and don't surrender to the myth of the garret, or the myth of the chained muse. It's like playing the guitar, or practicing taekwondo, or having sex. The more you do, the better you get. The better you get, the better it feels. The better it feels, the more you want to do." -- Jay Lake

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Dominic Behan
item.description: "Come all you young rebels and list while I sing For the love of one's country is a terrible thing It banishes fear with the speed of a flame And it makes us all part of their pattriot game." -- Dominic Behan

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "There comes a time when the cup of endurance runs over, and men are no longer willing to be plunged into the abyss of despair." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Victor Serge
item.description: "Carelessness on the part of revolutionaries has always been the best aid the police have." -- Victor Serge

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Gore Vidal
item.description: "I believe there's something very salutary in, say, beating up a gay-bashing policeman. Preferably one fights through the courts, through the laws, through education, but if at a neighborhood level violence is necessary, I'm all for violence. It's the only thing Americans understand." -- Gore Vidal

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Kuwasi Balagoon
item.description: "These people who judge us should take a city bus or a cab through the South Bronx, the Central Ward of Newark, North Philadelphia, the Northwest section of the District of Columbia or any Third World reservation, and see if they can note a robbery in progress. See if they recognize the murder of innocent people. This is the issue, the myth that the Imperialists should not be confronted and cannot be beaten is eroding fast and we stand here ready to do whatever to make the myth erode even faster, and to say for the record that not only will the Imperialist U.S. lose, but that it should lose." -- Kuwasi Balagoon

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Eduardo Galeano
item.description: "I don't believe in charity. I believe in solidarity." -- Eduardo Galeano

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "Some times I think this whole world Is one big prison yeard Some of us are prisoners The rest of us are guards" -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by George Jackson
item.description: "It's very contradictory for a man to teach about the murder in corporate capitalism, to isolate and expose the murderes behind it, to instruct that these madmen are completely without stops, are licentious, totally depraved — and then not make adequate preparations to defend himself from the madman's attack. Either they don't really believe their own spiel or they harbor some sort of subconscious death wish" -- George Jackson

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Michel Foucault
item.description: "The intellectual was rejected and persecuted at the precise moment when the facts became incontrovertible, when it was forbidden to say that the emperor had no clothes. " -- Michel Foucault

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "A lot of people don't have much food on their table. But they got a lot of forks 'n knives. And they got to cut somethin'." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by Jean-Luc Godard
item.description: "There is no such thing as intellectual property." -- Jean-Luc Godard

item.title: Kersplebedeb add a quote by William Gibson
item.description:
"The future is already here – it's just not evenly distributed.
<i>The Economist, December 4, 2003</i>" -- William Gibson
